      private void GUI.enableFocus​(Position p, boolean onf)
      This method is not being used in this project, since we move Player around by pressing the keys.
      private int Pirate.getDistanceToPlayer​(int x, int y, Position playerPosition)
      Since in Pirate Hunt game, Pirates always perform the best possible move relative to one which was made by Player.
      boolean Position.isEqual​(Position p)
      Method isEqual as parameter accepts one Position p and perform equality operation on it.
      boolean Board.isValidPosition​(Position p)
      Method that is the same as method isValidPosition(int x,int y), but accept actual Position.class object rather than x and y of type int.
      void Pirate.moveToPlayer​(Position playerPosition)
      Method moveToPlayer is used for deciding in which direction our Pirate should move.
      void Pirate.moveToPlayer​(Position playerPosition, int l)
      Different version of method moveToPlayer.
      java.lang.String Board.onPosition​(Position p)
      Method onPosition() returns Object that is stated on Position p provided as parameter.We ensure that parameter p of type Position is valid.
      void Board.removeBarrier​(Position p)  
      private void Position.removeClassObject​(Position p)
      Method removeClassObject removes Position.Object from Board that is assigned to Position.It uses Board.class methods removePlayer,removePirate and removeBarrier as they are only type of objects that can exist on Board
      void Board.removePirate​(Position p)  
      void Board.removePlayer​(Position p)
      Class method that remove Player.Object from this Board class.

      Setter for ClassObject.
      void Board.setPirate​(Position p)
      Setter for Pirate Object
      void Board.setPlayer​(Position p)
      Setter for Player Object.Firstly,we perform validity test on parameter Position then, if everything is fine, we assign String representing Player Object on respected point.
